Kidnapper (ÃƒÂ§Ã‚Â»Ã¢â‚¬ËœÃƒÂ¥Ã…â€™Ã‚Âª Bangfei) is a 2010 Singaporean thriller film about a kidnap set in Singapore. The first action-thriller film made by Kelvin Tong, it was a joint venture between Scorpio East Pictures of Singapore and RAM Pictures and PMP Entertainment from Malaysia.[1] Tong opted for a thriller film as opposed to an full-fledged action film as he felt this was more realistic in Singapore saying "people here (in Singapore) don't run around with machine guns".[2]
[edit] Plot

Lim is a struggling 40-year-old taxi driver whose wife divorced him years ago. He has a close relationship with his son, Wei Xiang, whom he chauffeurs to school every day. Mistaken for a rich manÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s son, Wei Xiang is kidnapped one day at an arcade and held for a ransom of S$1 million. Thus begins one fatherÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s relentless quest to get his son back.
